title: What the Glyph? Finding and Using Fonts for Your Projects
description: What’s a font? What’s a typeface? Why would you spend good money on buying a font when there are so many of them floating around for free?

title: Really Big Video Part 1
description: This session will introduce Big Building Mapping and Video Projection. I will begin by showing examples of site-specific and video mapping pieces and then we will map a real building using a spatial scan in Mad Mapper. For homework each camper will get a scan to work from and some tips on how to create giant projections. Part 2 of the session will allow campers to showcase their mapped work projected 3 stories tall on an actual building on broadway.

title: Command-line Fu: How not to get eaten by a Grue
CNC Fun Day
description:
Stacks on stacks of CNC education! You don’t really need anything to attend this session, just a good attitude!
 It’s gonna be rad!

title: ITP Mappathon: Projection Mapping with MadMapper
description:
Step 2
 This week, we will learn how to connect your visual content created from Modul8 to a projection mapping software, MadMapper.

title: Re-wiring for Re-cycling
description: Physical Computing strikes me as a unique opportunity to recycle materials destined for landfill while creating unique objects and experiences. I’ve recently come to realize that a large part of my increased comfort level with electronics derives from a shift in perspective; no longer do I simply see a lonely rusted bike wheel littering my neighborhood, but raw materials such as spokes that make great axles for rotating propellers and mirrors. The VCR I found outside my friend’s studio became a drawer of motors, buttons, and a tape reader that now scans discarded video tapes in tandem with that bike tire! So for this session I’d like to lead a conceptual and hands on workshop in which we dream up ways to use discarded electronics (which I will provide). What inventive ways will we think to use an air mattress pump? A robotic aerosol sprayer? A game involving a levitating object? The possibilities are vast and can only improve with a conceptual shift concerning everyday objects.

title: Turning on the lathe
description: **YOU MUST HAVE HAD A SHOP SAFETY TRAINING IN ORDER TO TAKE THIS CLASS.  NO EXCEPTIONS.**

title: Who’s your data? : A guide to Social Network mapping for fun, self knowledge and community building in the digital age.
UX Skill – Responsive Design Process
description: Do you create UX documents in Omnigraffle, Visio, InDesign, Axure or Illustrator?  Does the design team still create Photoshop PSD files to hand off to the developer?  That no longer works in the responsive design world we live in.

title: Now What?! How to turn your prototype into a product
description: When individuals and companies want to bring their product to the market, they run into hurdles like how to source materials, how to access a group of people who will buy it, and how to do it in a way that it doesn’t eat up all their savings and free time. This session is a crash course in the commercialization arc that includes product development, validation, and commercial ramp up.  Issues that arise in these post-prototype stages are important design insights that will make your product idea stronger. We’ll get into practical examples of how to connect with funding sources, user communities, and manufacturers while sharing resources that’ll be ready and waiting once camp is over.

title: Dancing with the Arduino Due
description: Now that you’re a couple weeks into camp, you’ve probably bumped up against the glass ceiling of the hardware you’re using. Common issues expressed by campers in previous years have been “My death robot has no more memory for kill routines!”, or “I want to just plug a mouse into my Arduino  to control my hypnotronic LED array”

title: Guest Speaker: Andrew Dent from Material ConneXion
description: Andrew Dent will be joining us to discuss what’s happening with materials and what’s soon to come.

title: Creating a Killer Finish
description: We have two great tools in the shop for applying a fantastic finish to wooden and metal projects.

title: Really Big Video Part 2
description: In this session, campers will compile and project their work from the previous week onto a giant building on broadway using video mapping and one really big projector. Taught by Gabe BC
